Topic.Title: Looking for example QUEST adventures to study

Posts.EditableText:
Is there a site that has Quest adventures in a format that I can load into quest to study so I can learn about ways of writig an adventure in Quest? 


Brian123
Posts.HTML:
Is there a site that has Quest adventures in a format that I can load into quest to study so I can learn about ways of writig an adventure in Quest?


Brian123

Posts.EditableText: If you download a Quest game afaik you can change the filename extension from .quest to .zip and obtain the .aslx out of them.
Posts.HTML: If you download a Quest game afaik you can change the filename extension from .quest to .zip and obtain the .aslx out of them.

Posts.EditableText: Have you worked through the [url=http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/:rdj0so6g]Tutorial[/url:rdj0so6g] in the documentation pages? This allows you to build a simple game building it step by step.
Posts.HTML: Have you worked through the Tutorial in the documentation pages? This allows you to build a simple game building it step by step.

Posts.EditableText:
Yes I have done most of the tutorial.

I wanted some variation of games to learn from.
Posts.HTML:
Yes I have done most of the tutorial.

I wanted some variation of games to learn from.

Posts.EditableText:
If you're talking about GAME DESIGNS, then play a bunch of games.

if you're talking about how to learn to implement more features~functionalities for within your games, you can look at the 'libraries and code samples' forum-board section here, and within the wiki, the 'how to' link~section is also very useful. Lastly, there's our posts in this very forum here itself. You can look through my posts, if you can handle code, and many others' posts too, such as, but not limited to, Jay's, Pixie's, Pertex', Sgreig's, and etc's posts.
